sub_title: Co-founder The Liberators: I create content & products, provide training, and facilitate (Liberating Structures) workshops to unleash (Agile & Scrum) teams all over the world!
summary:
As the co-founder of The Liberators, I liberate teams and organizations from outdated modes of working. I create space for everyone to be involved in shaping the future and to make a positive impact on their organization.

I highly enjoy providing (Scrum) training and workshop facilitation. As a trainer & facilitator, I help teams and groups to do their best thinking and to find local solutions to persistent challenges. 

My toolkit is packed with facilitation techniques, of which Liberating Structures are the most prominent. They make everyone feel heard, seen, and respected and help me get the most out of group interactions. 

I write blog posts, host meetups, and speak at conferences to share my lessons learned.

treasury_media.title: The Zombie Scrum Survival Guide
treasury_media.description: In our book, we reveal why Scrum often runs aground and we show how to supercharge your Scrum outcomes. We offer 40+ practical approaches, exercises, and tools for escaping Zombie Scrum.

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

projects.title: MN - "Agile Transformation"​

contributors.headline: Co-founder The Liberators: I create content & products, provide training, and facilitate (Liberating Structures) workshops to unleash (Agile & Scrum) teams all over the world!

projects.title: Schiphol "Digital Airport Program"
projects.description:
The digital revolution that currently occurs within the airline business has a tremendous impact for customers (passengers and airlines), airports and new business opportunities. Schiphol has the ambition to become the leading airport in this new world.

To cope with these challenges Schiphol started the Digital Airport Program in which Smart Airport and Seamless Passenger Journey are key projects. Important components of this program are the new enabling technologies that not only contribute to the realisation of the program, but also offer the opportunity to improve and support customer processes (passengers and airlines).

Schiphol started the ambitious Digital Airport Program with the goal to realise this vision. The program includes the digital transformation of Schiphol (departments, processes, people, assets), as well the introduction of tens of new IT products and services for passengers, customers, stakeholders and employees.

contributors.headline: Co-founder The Liberators: I create content & products, provide training, and facilitate (Liberating Structures) workshops to unleash (Agile & Scrum) teams all over the world!

projects.title: Schiphol "Indoor Wayfinding"​
projects.description: Schiphol has extended their mobile app with an indoor wayfinding module, assisting passengers in navigating through the terminals. The routes, POIs and generalized basemaps used by this app however, are created manually. This data coexists along with all the assets stored in SGIS and are manually synced. In order to automate the process, the routes, POIs and basemaps need to be generated from the source data in SGIS. This project is executed using the Scrum as guidance.

projects.description: Facilitated PGGM with the realization of the program "IFS Roadmap". This concerned establishing a suitable governance structure and outsourcing parts of the ICT and Facility Services department. The actual implementation of the program was done via multiple Scrum teams.

projects.title: ABN AMRO Hypotheken Groep
projects.description: The Business Intelligence department of ABN AMRO Hypotheken wanted to improve the workflow and hereby increase the predictability of the delivery. Therefore we created a delivery process that streamlined the workflow, made the progress transparent and offered the opportunity to gather & process feedback. As part of this transition within the BI-department, multiple Scrum teams were setup and trained.

projects.title: PGGM - Asset Management
projects.description: The Asset Management department of PGGM wanted a manifest that expressed their Agile way of working. In collaboration with the management and the agile teams the manifest was created. The department now has the desired principles they can use as their guidelines.

contributors.headline: Co-founder The Liberators: I create content & products, provide training, and facilitate (Liberating Structures) workshops to unleash (Agile & Scrum) teams all over the world!

projects.title: Topicus Finan BV - Agile transition
projects.description: Finan decided to implement Scrum with the goal to become value driven, instead of task driven and create a more responsive organisation. I have started 7 Scrum teams and trained the developers, Scrum Masters and Product Owners in their new role. A framework for sharing knowledge was build by setting up several communities of practices for all the different roles. This gave the organisation the opportunity to start new teams easier. I have initiated several workshops, trainings and coaching sessions at this company and provided a solid Agile foundation.

projects.title: Ziggo - "Redesign and rebuild Ziggo.nl"

It needed to support the mobile proposition, shorten the time-to-market concerning content management and increase execution power by using Continuous Delivery. I supported this project for Enrise by aligning multiple suppliers to create this new corporate website.

profile_positions.description:
As co-founder of The Liberators, it's our purpose to liberate teams from ineffective ways of organizing work by putting them in control of shaping their future. To achieve this purpose, we create products to help (Scrum) teams unleash their superpowers. We share a wide variety of content and support a community to learn and grow together.

- Products: the Agile/Scrum Team Survey, and all the items in our webshop.
- Content: books, blog posts & papers, podcast episodes, and videos
- Communities: The Liberators Network and the Dutch Liberating Structures User Group

Appreciate our work? Become a patron! (https://www.patreon.com/liberators). As a patron, you can get all sorts of nice benefits like early access to our content, exclusive meetups, and work with us on new initiatives, ideas, and content.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description: We - The Liberators Network - are a global community that exists to help Scrum & Liberating Structures practitioners find support, offer help, and draw inspiration. We believe in the power of peer-to-peer inspiration to overcome the tough challenges we face when we try to liberate teams and organizations from ineffective ways of working.
profile_positions.title: Organizer

profile_positions.description: As the co-creator of the PSM II class (together with Christiaan Verwijs), I help Scrum Masters take the next step in their personal journeys.
profile_positions.title: Professional Scrum Trainer

profile_positions.description: This is my personal holding. My main focus is the organization I've started with Christiaan Verwijs: The Liberators. That's where the magic happens!
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description: Helping individuals, teams and organizations with Scrum.
profile_positions.title: Scrum Master

profile_positions.description:
Enrise builds robust and innovative applications and websites.

Tasks as a Scrum Master
- Set up, coach and train Scrum teams
- Stimulate and facilitate personal growth of the team members
- Structure, facilitate and guard the process
- Mitigate risks and impediments
- Protect the team from disturbances
- Support the Product Owner with managing the project budget, scope and quality
- Evangelise Scrum within and around the organisation 

Tasks as a Team Lead:
- Guard the personal and financial goals
- Coordinate operational management, forecasting and team planning
- Manage customer relationships
profile_positions.title: Scrum Master & Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
• Support the implementation of a new insurance application
• Hands-on consultancy in projects
• Advise key users and management
• Functional maintenance of new systems
profile_positions.title: Application Consultant

profile_positions.description:
• IT maintenance and management for the head quarters and shops
• Lead and participate in multiple projects
• Point of contact for internal departments and external clients for ICT related questions
• Organise and give trainings to users of several applications
• Maintain the flow of information between applications
• Define and manage Service Level Agreements
• Write and maintain procedures
• Ensure the necessary improvement of applications
• Give second and third line support
profile_positions.title: IT Consultant / Project Leader
